subContent.desc: Software Tech Lead (2023 - 2025): Cory served as a Software Tech Lead within the J&J MedTech division, overseeing multiple teams and offering technical guidance. He led a team that was building an iOS app designed to connect to a medical device, contributing to the development of innovative solutions within the MedTech space. Although his recent experience had centered on backend API development in Java, his role was focused primarily on team leadership and maintaining technical alignment. In this position, Cory also led the Sustaining team, a crucial part of the VELYS Digital ecosystem responsible for maintaining the security and stability of services and the codebase. His team focused on addressing bugs, updating frameworks and dependencies proactively, and ensuring the overall security and mitigation of vulnerabilities. Cory actively contributed to onboarding new customers, facilitating a seamless transition into the VELYS Digital ecosystem, and provided top-notch support to the Product Support team, diligently resolving customer issues and delivering exceptional assistance.

Software Engineer (2019 - 2023): Cory was a member of the Core Tools team at Google + Fitbit. The team built and maintained an internal support tool and the backend that powered it. Customer support agents used this tool to diagnose issues with customers' Fitbit devices. The work included the writing and maintaining of backend apis as well as adding new features to and maintaining the front-end Ember app.

Front-end Engineer (2015 - 2019): Cory worked on many aspects of the fitbit.com website. The store, shop pages, product pages, new product launches, holiday campaigns and the blog were just a few of the areas he worked on. The stack fitbit.com was built on included Javascript, Mithril, HTML5, CSS3, Lodash and Metalsmith.

Cory began his career as an intern before advancing to an internal contractor role and ultimately securing a full-time position. In this capacity, he successfully delivered more than five full-scale websites from concept through deployment, managing each stage of the process from initial client consultation to final launch. He collaborated closely with clients to understand their needs, translate requirements into effective solutions, and ensure project goals were achieved with high-quality results. His work spanned both design and development, including the creation of digital assets that enhanced user experience and supported brand identity. Through these efforts, Cory gained hands-on experience in end-to-end project delivery while building strong relationships with clients and team members alike.

Washed away was a typography experiment where a Garamond letter "A" was sculpted out of sand and videoed while slowly getting washed away by the tide. Images from the video were published in Barbara Brownies book Typed Image. It was a really fun project but tense as well. Contending with the impeding tide made it quite difficult to time properly. This video is embedded locally, using the HTML5 video element.

‘More Than Design’ was a gallery for our senior thesis projects. My project was the creation of www.actkindblog.com, a community blog about acts of kindness. Users are able to write and comment about kind acts they have done, seen, or heard about. To accompany the site, a physical blog page was printed and displayed in the show. People were encouraged to write kind acts on post-it notes and stick them on the poster and surrounding walls. 150 kind act post-it notes were put up that night. These post-its were then photographed and are periodically posted on the blog under the title ‘150 Days of Kindness.’

People Incorporated tasked us with re-designing and re-evaluating their space for improved functionality. A re-organization system was created to achieve the utmost service to their customers. We displayed our ideas and suggestion to them through a scaled model of their first floor. Some of the recommendations we proposed were, better lighting, more efficient storage and lighter wall colors.

In this poster series, I was limited to two colors per poster. The design of each poster needed to have constants, variables and needed to reflect the definition of the word. Cory’s father was kind enough to be the model, adding a humorous and dynamic element to the series.

Rebuilt is a book I wrote and designed about my experience in basic training. Its an emotional journey of how I found self-confidence, inner strength and personal courage. This project was an exercise in looking inward and personal honesty.

An AI-powered chatbot backend that serves as an interactive, AI-driven resume and portfolio. Built with FastAPI and Python 3.11+, the chatbot uses Groq API with Llama 3.1 8B Instant model for ultra-fast inference and implements a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline with ChromaDB vector database for semantic search.

Try it out on the homepage of this site! Ask the chatbot questions about Cory's technical skills, work experience, leadership approach, or any projects listed in this portfolio. The chatbot has been trained on comprehensive professional information and can provide detailed, contextual responses about his background and expertise.

The system features production optimizations including Redis caching, GZIP compression for 70% smaller responses, streaming responses, and rate limiting. Deployed on Google Cloud Run with automated CI/CD via Cloud Build, the chatbot achieves response times under 1 second and includes CORS protection restricting access to coryfitzpatrick.com. The architecture supports multi-turn conversations with context awareness and includes bot protection middleware.

View the source code on GitHub

Try it for yourself

A sophisticated CLI tool designed to streamline job application preparation by creating customized cover letters using AI. The system analyzes a user's professional background and matches it with job descriptions to produce tailored application materials.

How to Use: After installing via pip, run the interactive CLI with cover-letter-cli. The tool will guide you through loading your professional documents (resume PDFs, LinkedIn exports, or JSON files). When ready, simply paste a job posting URL and the tool automatically scrapes the webpage to extract the company name, job title, and full job description—no manual copy-pasting required. The AI then generates a customized cover letter tailored to that specific position. You can provide feedback to refine the output iteratively until you're satisfied with the results. The final cover letter is automatically saved as a PDF in a folder named '{Company} - {Job Title}'.

Technical Details: Built with Python 3.11+, the tool uses Groq's Llama 3.3 70B Versatile model for text generation and implements Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) with ChromaDB for storing and retrieving document embeddings. This RAG approach ensures the AI generates content based on your actual professional experience rather than generic templates. The intelligent web scraping automatically parses job posting pages to extract relevant information, streamlining the entire application process. The system supports multiple input formats including PDFs (resumes, achievement documents), LinkedIn CSV exports, and JSON files containing professional information.

Key Features: Automatic job posting scraping from URLs, intelligent extraction of company name and job title, interactive CLI for generation with iterative refinement through user feedback, automatic PDF generation organized into folders named '{Company} - {Job Title}', Google Drive integration for cloud storage, and customizable system prompts for controlling tone and style.

View the source code on GitHub
